verbose_text: Since SD induces (a) an acceleration of the baseline electrophysiological dynamics at SO and (b) an increase of the delta, theta and alpha activity during REC sleep, we hypothesize that the higher homeostatic sleep pressure should determine an earlier onset of oscillatory EEG changes during the falling-asleep process that usually occurs later during a night of sleep under normal conditions.
evidence: SD induces (a) an acceleration of the baseline electrophysiological dynamics at SO                            and (b) an increase of the delta, theta and alpha
